sources.data_found: Center for High-Performance Computing (CHPC), provides users access to advanced computing hardware including over 2,500 CPU cores and over 80 NVIDIA A100 and H100 GPU's.

The facility maintains both CPU-only and GPU-accelerated computing nodes with the most capable datacenter GPUs commercially available, including modular (SXM) NVIDIA H100, A100 (80G), and A100 (40G) with dual-socket 5th Generation Intel Xeon and AMD EPYC processors with intra-nodal NVSWITCH as well as PCIe A100, V100S, V100, T4, and K20 GPU-accelerated nodes.
The A&S Condo consists of a number of nodes containing more than 500 cores, 8TB RAM and 8 NVIDIA Ampere A100, PCIe, 80GB GPUs.

During the 2021-2022 academic year, Washington University in St Louis handed out 205 bachelor's degrees in computer science. This is an increase of 6% over the previous year when 193 degrees were handed out. In 2022, 78 students received their master's degree in compsci from WUSTL.
In 2023, 260 degrees were awarded to men at Washington University in St Louis in Computer Science, which is 3.42 times more than the 76 female recipients with that same degree.

student_data.notes: Student counts estimated based on degrees awarded. Undergrad CS: ~205 degrees/year × 4 years = 820 students. Graduate CS: ~78 MS degrees/year × 2 years = 156 students. PhD CS: estimated ~15 degrees/year × 5 years = 75 students. In 2023, total CS degrees awarded was 336 (260 men + 76 women) per DataUSA.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Mentioned in facilities documentation but count not specified
Mentioned in facilities documentation but count not specified
Mentioned in facilities documentation but count not specified

gpu_resources.notes: Total of 'over 80 NVIDIA A100 and H100 GPU's' reported by CHPC. Breakdown estimated as: 40 H100 SXM + 44 A100 (24 A100 80GB + 20 A100 40GB) = 84 total. A&S Condo has 8 A100 80GB PCIe GPUs (included in the 24 A100 80GB count). Additional V100 count estimated at 20. Other GPUs (V100S, T4, K20) mentioned but specific counts not available. SLURM scheduler used for job management.

analysis_notes: Washington University in St. Louis operates the Center for High-Performance Computing (CHPC) within the Research Computing and Informatics Facility (RCIF). The facility has over 80 high-end GPUs (A100 and H100) but exact model-by-model breakdown not publicly documented. Student enrollment estimated from degrees awarded data.
